author: treyzania
content: honestly the wikipedia article for merkle trees explains it pretty well imo https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Merkle_tree

author: treyzania
content: Ethereum technically uses a merkle-patricia trie, which in eth's variant each node has 16 children, which decreases the amount of lookups that nodes need to do to traverse the tree to find an account's state, but it increases the size of proofs for those states
